page.title: 17CROSS COUNTRY RUNNING
page.content: The start of a run used by Stoneygate School pupils is in a middle-class area on the school side of the Leicestershire Golf Course. The run takes us through the Course and out onto Shady Lane, onto Gartree Road, then running all the way up to the roundabout. We pass undulating land which used to be a medieval farm, and Piggie's Hollow, the remains of a Norman settlement. Our schoolboy humour says that throughout the run we must be alert for whizzing golf balls, or we may be confronted by the Golf Course Flasher who lurks behind the trees waiting to jump at you. We also need to know that the strange hand prodding us in the back is only the running teacher. Two of our teachers run in the Leicester Marathon which uses part of the London Road in our block.
